intro: Trianoptiles solitaria, commonly known as the solitary trianoptile, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
